text: Ordered a Denver scramble for take away. Got home and opened the box to watery eggs and 4 tomato slices. This meal was utterly disgusting. The chefs should be ashamed of themselves. I'll never go here again and I live down the street. Yolk is right down the street.

This is our second time here and we never go to the same place twice because there are so many place that we would to try but this breakfasts hang out is one of the best, it extremely organized, it' s always crowded not to worry never more that a 5 min wait the best part is the service is excellent, your order is plated precfectly and just the way that you ordered it, one of the small touches is that every table has all of the condiments that you will need, 3 types of sugar, creamers, salt pepper, pitcher of water with Lemon,hot sauce, ketchup, pitcher of coffee now that way to start your day

Pretty good diner-like food. I have ordered one of the egg dishes in the past and most recently ordered the Cobb salad with a side of hash browns. It was fine! The Cobb salad could have used more veggies and less iceberg lettuce but I get that this isn't a salad bar. The portions are huge and the service was friendly. You will definitely leave here feeling full and satisfied.

Great service and great food. They accommodated our 10 people group within a very short time since we had a baby in the back room which was so convenient .. michael was a great server! Keep it up buddy.

We ate here for breakfast two days in a row! Even when it was busy on Sunday, we didn't wait long. Both days, we had great servers AND great food. I love that they leave a pitcher of water on your table and a carafe of coffee. That alone took it over the top. The selection on the menu was fabulous and affordable pricing. It's on my list of breakfast places to return to.

This is a good Streeterville brunch spot. We showed up on a Thursday morning and got seated right away. The menu is HUGE. I split two orders, a breakfast burrito and some pancakes, with a friend. Pancakes were fluffy and beautiful, if not as special as some other Chicago brunch place pancakes. The breakfast burrito was super yummy. The stars of the show were the breakfast potatoes. Delicious! Service was slow, which was unfortunate, but our server was solidly knowledgeable and nice.
Awesome service, awesome food and cool venue. The prices are quite good and we'll definitely be having breakfast here again!

This breakfast cafe was very busy on the Sunday morning that we went. However we got sat within 5 minutes of getting there. The service was nice and fast. Also, the portion of food you get is quite big for breakfast. Overall, my experience with West Egg Cafe was very good. Our food came out very fast and it was fresh!!

This was a great place for a quick affordable breakfast... it was crowded when we came in so I was worried about service and food but they were both amazing!!! Would highly recommend the eggs Benedict was great!!
Yum yum food. Ordered their veggie omelet and the kids ordered pancakes and French toast. Delicious food. Great customer service

If you're in the Chicago area and you're looking for a fantastic breakfast place this is it. From the omelettes to the pancakes they were overwhelm you with not only the portions but the remarkable taste of their breakfast entries . This is definitely a price performer.
One advice: do not get the egg Benedict!!!! In fact it's be a better idea not even try this place!
Loved the atmosphere and the food. I would of given them 5 stars if they had turkey bacon on the menu. More places need to offer this.
Some of the best bacon I've had in a long time! This quaint little breakfast spot is one I'll come visit again for sure! Quick seating and service with excellent food.
Good food and fast service. Our waiter Michael was nice. Perfect little spot to grab a bite to eat and get your day going.

The hotel we are at recommended this restaurant for breakfast this morning.  Aside from the hair on my coffee cup and the dirt we noticed inside my husband's coffee cup, the food was mediocre at best. My husband ordered the eggs Benedict and had to send them back twice because the whites were so runny.  The third time the egg whites were cooked, but the yolk was the texture of a hard boiled egg.  The waitress kept apologizing and did her best and ultimately took our drinks off our check due to the issues.  I had the lox and eggs which was very bland and had very little lox.  Needless to say we would not recommend this place and won't be back.
Michael, is a friendly server doesn't have to write down our four orders. Everything was the way we ordered. Just a block from our hotel.

I am halfhearted and well irresolute about this place. The food is hunky-dory to both visual and tasting considerations.  I had the Claras Con Salsa. A proposal of layers and many folds of colors and textures. The green chilis, salsa and tomato slices we're contributive to the mexicali flavour. The only thing that mars the dining experience was the lukwarm service. Our server was polite and courteous but could be more engaging.

Location is easy to get to, but it is always busy and they have two lines going on. The one line is from the street entrance, and the second line they have a little Court towards the center near the check out cashier. My wife and I have been here on many other occasions and the only problem we have and have had, are the flying gnats that do not allow you to enjoy your meal.  It's very annoying to have to swat them away with one hand, while you the other hand is feeding you. The portions have always been midwestern style big, so that's pretty good. The place has been here for a long long time and they always have a huge crowd coming in, as there is a few hotels near the restaurant. Prices are fair, we shared the original skillet with scrambled eggs, bacon onion and gravy. I'm not sure if they use real bacon bc it was tuff and chopped up finely (it looks and taste love like the dry bacon you shake out of a plastic bottle).  Since the problem with the flying gnats  has not been resolved and apparently they don't care, we will not be coming back. Who knows what happened with unattended open kitchen ingredients. But if you do not have a problem with gnats fighting you for your hot breakfast, then you will enjoy their delicious breakfast platters.

I wanted to like this place. It seems like a nice family owned diner.  The food was okay. I had an omelet and my fiancé had eggs and toast. Our server was a bit surely. Overall, the absolute worst of this place was that there were fruit fries all over. Literally there was one in the pitcher of water on the table. We were swatting at flies throughout our entire meal. I couldnt get out of there fast enough.

Honestly not that impressed and not sure why this place has such high reviews. Coffee is served in plastic soda cups which is unappealing and honestly just plain weird. My dish (eggs and sautéed veggies) was edible but that's about it - not hot and lacking flavor. Their fresh fruit was good but that's about it. Wouldn't return

I LOVE this place. My office is right down the block and usually what I do is order lunch from my desk & walk over. My food is always ready within a minute of me arriving (less than 10 minutes of me ordering). I order from West Egg about once a week and I can't remember a time I've been disappointed. The salads are fresh and the chicken they use is freshly cooked and very flavorful. The portions are fair & the prices are good for Chicago. The staff is also very friendly.
Worst ever eggs benedict.  Improperly poached and mushy. Server only inquired about my husband's meal.
Very good breakfast and one of the best values I had the entire trip to Chicago. Good, fast, fresh. Worth swinging in.

West Egg was delicious! I had the blueberry pancakes! They were fresh with blueberries inside and a compote for on top. Service was nice and the food came out within a fairly reasonable time. My only thing is that I wish they had mimosas!

Tasty brunch with huge portions and fair prices! I tried the huevos rancheros which came as a mountain of chorizo, cheese, sour cream, avocado, and eggs on corn tortillas. Yum! I loved that they brought our table an entire carafe of coffee so we didn't need to ask for refills.
My favorite place for breakfast when I'm in Chicago. The counter service is fast and the food is always delicious. Some interesting skillet/scramble and omelette options make it tough to decide.

This diner was near our hotel, The Courtyard, and we arrived around 8:30am from an early flight. We were pretty hungry and we saw this on Yelp and was actually one of the options given by the front desk. The service was prompt and friendly. The food came out suspiciously quickly. I ordered the raisin French toast with bacon, my mother ordered eggs, turkey sausage and home fries. My French Toast had a good flavor, but it was warm and not hot. The bacon wasn't crispy, but also was just barely warm. My mother said her meal lacked flavor and was also barely warm. The coffee was the best part of the meal. It was hot and tasted great. Without the coffee and friendly service it wouldn't have been worth coming.
Look no further than The Skillet and a Waffle (enough to share).  Delicious!  Also friendly staff and quick service.   Walked right in on a Sunday and sat, but the reastuant was full.
I think this place is good? Honestly I was still drunk from the night before. It was pretty good as hangover food. Would like to go back sober.
Fast service and very good breakfast. The pancakes were hot and good. When I'm back in Chicago I'll definitely be returning.

West Egg is one of those places I return to for breakfast over and over. The atmosphere is fun, cozy and lively, the pace is fast, and it's just a good way to start your day whenever you have time to sit down for a breakfast. I've found that the food and coffee is always consistent, service is always timely and it just does a great job at being a neighborhood casual diner spot.

All i have to say for this spot is omggggg. I came here for breakfast on Saturday and I'm happy i did. Upon arriving we were seated immediately and ordered our food that came rapidly. What i also liked about this spot is there leave a whole crock pocket of coffee at your table, so you don't need to keep calling your waiter/ waitress over to bring coffee. I ordered turkey over eggs Benedict and i kid you not, it was the best breakfast and turkey egg Benedict i ever had in my life. The turkey was home made and not cold cuts turkey. The eggs Benedict was cooked to perfection and came with a nice fruit salad. My friend ordered steak and eggs which he enjoyed. He ate everything on that plate down to the gristle and kept raving about this place. Location was excellent this place is located in magnificent mile and right across from out hotel,so it was perfect especially after a night of drinking our self into cirrhosis. If you are in Chicago, this place is definitely place to check out. Food comes rapid and the food is banging. Highly recommend

I came here for breakfast with my wife and we were blown away how awesome this place was. They have a huge menu with a ton of options. The service was great, the food was great and so was the environment. I really enjoyed this place for breakfast and we will definitely be back. Highly recommended.
If you are looking for a great local place to have down to earth breakfast this is it. Enjoyed the meal and service here!

My wife had the Steak Raul sandwich and enjoyed it, I tried a bite and agreed that it was good.  I had the soup of the day (house made chicken noodle) which included a small salad and homemade focaccia tomato bread (served warm, it was excellent).  At $4.95 my soup/salad/bread combo was a major deal!

Solid option.  Came here because of the wait elsewhere. Staff was great and food was very good. I thought the menu was missing some classics, but staff was happy to make menu switches. Decent atmosphere.  Would definitely go back if in the area.

Hadn't eaten here since my time in the Navy in Chicago. Going back 20+ years later it did not disappoint. The wife and kids loved it too and I got a chance to start our Chicago trip off with an old friend.

Both my husband and I really liked this place.  Had our first visit this morning.  Thoroughly enjoyed the California Crepe (broccoli, mushrooms, avocado & eggs).  Perfectly prepared fresh vegetables.  Also enjoyed the corned beef hash skillet.  Rudy was our server.  Friendly and efficient.  Super quick service.  Got our meals within 5-10 minutes of ordering.  Look forward to our next visit.

Not a relaxing place to eat. It is set up to have the most tables packed into the smallest place possible. Tables are so close you are engaged in everyone's conversations whether or not you want to be. If it hadn't been for the kind person who told me to "look for the guy in the blue hat" I never would have known how to get my name on the wait list. But, when Blue Hat Guy said it was a 12-minute wait, that was almost to the minute. Definitely worth waiting for. Our waiter, Michael, was on the move, but checked on us regularly, answered menu questions, brought a full pot of coffee (fresh - benefit to a packed restaurant) and managed to make it a great breakfast experience. The food is excellent. Decent portions, flavorful, beautiful and reasonably priced. Basic eggs, waffles, French toast and skillet dishes seemed to be ordered the most. The wait-staff was friendly, but Michael seemed to care the most, and the bus-staff gets the award for clearing and re-setting tables at light-speed. Only reason I can't give it a five-star rating is the cramped table setup.
The food is good and the amount is sufficient. love it. The vibe is family-feeling, which makes me very comfortable.
Really good!  Efficient seating. Nice people.  Good food.  Fair price.  Enjoyed a lot.

Came here for a Saturday brunch with some friends. I love omelettes for brunch, and they have a wide array of different omelettes to choose from. I got the bandito omelette, which was good, but not amazing. Our server was patient and attentive. They don't sell mimosas, which sucks, but it was an enjoyable experience overall. The location is superb, right in the middle of downtown.

Simple, straight-forward and fast breakfast. If you are ever on the go and need fast (but good) breakfast, come here. It is NOT touristy and does not get overcrowded when I go. It's diner style and the staff are friendly. For those who don't think that the servers are happy, it's because they come during rush hour and there's not enough staff to give above and beyond customer service. If you want above and beyond, go to the Ritz Carlton.

Food is outstanding and probably would have gotten the 4th star if it wasn't for our server.  He seems like he didn't want to be there, and practically grunted at us when we requested a stirrer for coffee.  He forgot my side order of Corned beef hash ( which is probably for the better as my inlet was HUGE). Very crowded. Food came out of the kitchen in less than 5 minutes.  Would come back if I don't get the same server. Service also makes for a great dining experience. Ok so service is really bad here. Originally gave 3 stars because of service and removed another star.  We couldn't find our server so asked another server for our check and he just said your server will be with you. 10 minutes later still have not seen our server.  This will definitely keep me away

This is my 2nd time here at West Egg Cafe and I feel like I have to eat here more often so that I could explore the food in their Menu. Good for breakfast, Yes. They have the best breakfast food. Everything was like heaven in this place. The staff is also amazing, it consists of amazing managers and very friendly staff. I like how they approach their customers. From the bottom of my heart. Thank you West Egg Cafe. Everything is because you give effort on what you do. Please stay that way.

Great diner breakfast, with a homey-country style vibe. Wanted a quick, inexpensive, great tasting food place and got exactly that! Very extensive menu with your typical brunch favorites. Very quick service. I got the skillet breakfast, lot of food, cheap, with rich flavors.

The rate the restaurant 4 stars based on quick service, and quality of food. In our party we order Albuquerque turkey skillet which consist of egg muffin, turkey slice and pouched eggs on top and slice of avocado with a side of potato. The dish was an excellent balance and filling meal for lunch. The bandito breakfast meal consist of chorizo, eggs, sour cream and guacamole. A little heavy and spicy for my taste but overall okay meal. The Michael Angelo meal consist of eggs topped off with tomato sauce and cheese, resemblance to a pizza for breakfast. Additionally we ordered biscuit and gravy for the table, we all agreed the gravy was delicious however the biscuit was toasted enough for my liking. Overall, the experience was great. I would recommend this restaurant to others.

Busy place with standard breakfast fare... Quickly shown a table which already had a pitcher of water with lemon, waited a few minutes for the waiter who came just once to get both drink and food orders (I guess the water on the table took care of the usual first pass), and then was brought a carafe of coffee which was weak but plentiful...  Friend had the veggie omelette, unfortunately it seemed like they didn't sauté the veggies first because the inside of the omelette was watery.  I had poached eggs with potatoes and chicken sausage.. Eggs were properly runny, potatoes were well seasoned, sausage patties were a large portion... My only complaint was that all of it was lukewarm...

Every time I've come here this place did not disappoint. It's a cozy little spot amidst the cities tough exterior. Food has always been fresh and service superb. Some times there's a long wait but it goes to show the demand. The only fault I can find with this place is purely aesthetic. There's a U-shaped bar in the southern area of the restaurant. I'm not sure what it is about it but it's awkward to the eye. Perhaps because there's no focal point. Like I said, it has nothing to do with the food or service. But maybe a gatsby-like grandfather clock on the wall would add to the appearance.
Average breakfast, definitely better places in the area to try over this. Would not recommend.

excellent place with a wide variety to choose from.  I had the Grandma Meechie's corned beef hash & eggs - it was excellent.  my mom had the mushroom  & cheddar burger - also an excellent choice.  portions are very generous.

Overall this is a very nice establishment and it made the wife happy, which is half the battle.  Service- A+ = friendly, attentive, knowledgeable about menu. Around enough to be helpful but not annoying.  Food- B+ = I had the Grandma's corn beef hash with two eggs over easy. The fruit was fresh and a nice touch and the English muffin was charred just right. My eggs were also cooked perfectly but the corn beef hash was lacking. When I think of corn beef has its thick chunks of meat vs ground pieces I was served. It had good flavor but the ground meat part killed it for me. Wife ordered the turkey eggs Benedict and they were pretty solid and the eggs were cooked perfect.  Would definitely give this place a go again, as it was a very nice eating experience.

Yawn, that's how I felt after a recent breakfast at West Egg Cafe. And really you want breakfast to be the meal that wakes you up and powers you through the day. I had the veggie eggs Benedict which I usually think as a pretty easy dish to nail. How hard is it to make a delicious sauce with eggs and butter? And alas, the hollandaise was pretty flavorless the veggies were really firm and I really had to make use of the steak knife to cut through them and the english muffins were lame.
One of the awesome places in Chicago to have breakfast!! Lovely ambience, food and awesome service makes this place my absolute favourite.

For what would be a typical neighborhood breakfast spot, this place hit all the marks dead center. From their breakfast counter service to a wide range of table sizes this place seems to handle almost any size if group.  Everyone gets their own personal coffee thermos so there is no waiting for the all important refill.  It's a little in the loud side but personally I kind of like that hustle and bustle atmosphere. So, if you want a quiet place to contemplate your day, walk on by.

Walked in before the rush.  This place was crazy packed!  Got seated in 2 minutes.  Fresh ground coffee and lemon water came in less than a couple minutes and we ordered!  2 people.. about $35 and that was with an extra side of supple and fresh blueberries and strawberries with whipped cream to boot.  The Blue Bayou is a must have in my opinion.  Impressed!  Did I mention the food came in like 10 minutes after we ordered!  Made fresh and with the quickness!!!!

Stop looking for other places to have breakfast. Seriously, this is a great place. Coffee comes in jars so you can keep pouring refills on your mug, they have milk and half & half available, white sugar or raw as well. Also juice and other drinks but for breakfast I go with coffee! The menu is huge: omelettes, pancakes, French toast recipes, skillets, fruit bowls, mixed plates with sausage, eggs, bacon, biscuits, gravy, etc etc etc!! Anything you could possibly want for breakfast. On top of all that, the service is friendly and very fast. Last thing: they don't have free wifi

Great breakfast spot! If you're ravenous and don't want to wait long for your first meal of the day, I'd say come here. I don't know exactly how long it took for my food to be delivered to my table, but I know it was quick-the table next to me (family of 3) ordered and got theirs in precisely 5 minutes!  The first thing you'll notice is that every table is already prepared with all the condiments you'll need, coffee mugs, water cups, and a whole jug of iced lemon water. Very nice not to concern yourself with water refills, it's all there. Very large portions, so be prepared! In my experience, Eggs Benedict is usually served to fill one person, including the sides that may come with it, however, I could only finish half of one order! The Albuquerque Turkey Benedict is traditional to the recipe but with (many) slices of turkey instead of Canadian bacon and creamy avocado added. Tasty, served hot, service with a smile!
This is a nice place. The food was good, coffee plentiful and the staff was very nice as well. We are breakfast and enjoyed it very much. It is right across from the Hilton Doubletree.

My food tasted good, and that's what really matters. But the whole ambience felt rushed. There's clearly a high turn over as they move customers in and out very quickly. Yes, they leave coffee and water out for self service, and that's cool. But we ordered different egg dishes that came out looking the same. I would definitely go again, but just with different expectations than what I thought my sit down breakfast was going to be.

We had a great breakfast at West Egg Cafe! Our waitress was so kind and she made sure everything was perfect. The biscuits were flakey fresh. My daughter is very picky, and she said, "This is the best breakfast I've ever had!" My wife's eggs were fixed the way she asked. The portion of bacon as a side was substantial. The bacon was crispy and a bit dry, but still inviting. My biscuits and gravy was hot and flavorful. We will come back
The food is great and the staff is really friendly. I always get the mag mile mushrooms. The hot coffee is much better than the iced coffee - they simply pour the hot coffee over ice.

Delicious! Many of the reviews I read prior to dining were spot on. It took us a bit to decide on what to order because the menu is HUGE but once we did our food came out in 5 minutes. The waitress was great and the staff was friendly.  The breakfast potatoes are very good, they had great seasoning!

This was a good spot! We were seated immediately, and we were quickly greeted by our server, who was very very sweet. The breakfast potatoes were amazing! Some some complaints: the temperature of the restaurant was FREEZING, also, the eggs seemed over cooked.
A super comfortable, no pretense, good comfort food experience. The skillets are delicious, a definite repeat flag for me.
Very nice cafe. Reasonably priced. The food is delicious. I had the feta frittata and it was excellent!!

You can tell when a place is well-run by the way they clean the tables and service waiting customers.  This place gets very crowded on some days, but service is fast.  The menu is quite large and the staff are friendly and professional.  This place is a winner for breakfast in crowded touristy Chicago.

This breakfast place is busy especially on the weekends, but the owner is quick to have you seated as they have plenty of tables and seating areas in the front, back and outside. Free coffee while you wait for your table. You can always join at the "bar" for immediate seating as it is based on first come first serve. My favorite option at the West Egg is the "Huevos Rancheros". The portions are excellent and you definitely will not go home hungry.

I would give them a 3.5 because it's not a place I long to come back to but it's also not a place I wouldn't want to visit again. It's a solid breakfast place. Service was amazing, everyone was friendly and the wait wasn't bad at all. I was a bit disappointed because the only cream they offer was half and half and I was a bit disappointed with the menu options. I wish there were more customizable options. For example, one of the skillets were bacon and onion and I don't like onions so I wish I could've built my own skillet. I had Rod's Country Fry with over easy eggs, which was tasty. Again, nothing to write home about but the fact it doesn't have a wait like Yolk and the staff were EXTREMELY polite I would go back again.
Great service, location and well priced.  Had a simple "2 egg" breakfast and it was wonderful.  Much better deal than the fast food chain around the corner.

A totally forgettable experience with extremely mediocre food that arrived cold and bland. Another member of the group didn't get their food until we'd finished. Yelpers let me down on this one badly.  No bueno.
Good food, bad coffee. We didn't have to wait long for a table but it wasn't a busy time. Great for breakfast.

The breakfast potatoes are the best I've ever had! And the oj tastes so fresh!! Biscuits & gravy were pretty sub par. The servings are pretty big, but the meals only come with one piece of bacon... So stingy!!
Nice place to get breakfast. Fast service and good prices for Chicago. We both had an omelette and it was pretty good. A little noisy but not bad.

Over a long weekend in Chicago we hit up West Egg twice. Since it was so close to our hotel, and we liked the fast, casual breakfast, it was a no brainer while traveling with a toddler. We got there around 9AM both days and did not have to wait, but shortly after that people were waiting. The food and service is SUPER FAST, so no one was waiting too long.  My wife and I both had pancakes on Saturday and really enjoyed them. Our favorites were the blueberry and wheat germ pancakes. Health and delish. The second day I had the Western Omelet which was great, and my wife got the skillet. The coffee, food, and service were all great. Expect to pay $8-$12 per person depending on what you order. For Chicago brunch, this is a great little spot with plenty of healthy options.  Pro Tip if traveling with a stroller. Go to the Ontario Street side entrance. There is a ramp for easy stroller storage/access.
Yummy!!    We came at 9:30 on a Saturday morning before a Cubs game.   Waited 30 minutes.  Worth the wait!  Food came fast. Great staff.   Food was excellent!!   We will be back.

Average breakfast cafe but well worth it. The fact that you don't have to ask for water because there is a pitcher on your table is not a reason to give the cafe a unfavorable rating. I recommend this cafe...

This is one of my go-to weekend brunch spots.  There's always a wait but it usually moves way faster than you expect - and faster than other brunch places. First timer tip: look for the guy with a hat and glasses holding a notebook to put your name down.  I almost always order the buried treasure pancakes and a coffee. The pancakes are really light/soft and loaded with blueberries. It has more of a cake-like texture, which I love.  I also had some of the egg dishes and they come with quite a bit of food. Overall, I'd recommend if you're looking for a breakfast place nearby

Perfect for a casual brunch -- they do the basics well, portions are surprisingly big for the prices + location in the city. Staff is nice too! Things move fast here -- the wait time, the food, the speed of people coming in and out, etc. Aka the place is pretty busy -- so you may want to look somewhere else if you want a fancier or more laid-back place.  In summary: GREAT for the food + bang for your buck. Huge menu and lots of choices (and eggs too, duh). Not really great for ambiance / not a lot of coffee options / save your artsy Instagram'ing for elsewhere in the city
The food was amazing, fresh hot coffee, great service, good prices. We will definitely come back this place makes yolk look very bad.

Amazing! If you're looking for a quality low cost breakfast downtown and are in a hurry this is it. I recommend the skillet and omelet, large portions and they leave a pitcher of water and coffee on the table for you which came in extremely handy after a 1am exit from Timothy O'tooles  only 7 hours prior. Those darn early trains!

I ordered my food over the phone to go but ended up dining in.  The person I spoke with was really helpful in pointing me in the right direction as far as what to order.  Once I arrived, the staff willingly accommodated me by allowing me to sit at the bar.  I really enjoyed the Berry Pancakes.  They were very delicious and with the preserves and butter mixed it  really added an extra flavor that was like a party in my mouth.  Now, I'm giving this place 3 stars not because the food wasn't good but because the serving sizes are way too big and the bacon was a little rubbery.  I would come again but will definitely pay more attention to the menu to see if they offer half orders.

Great food, great service. My boyfriend got yogurt and granola and I had two eggs, potatoes, and English muffin. The food came out in less than 10 mins, our waitress was very busy but great!! This is a great simple, yummy, quick breakfast spot! Coffee was good too!

First of all, get your coffee at Starbucks. It's cheaper. $2. 954 for diner coffee?? Second of all use a restroom at a gas station, it's cleaner. Food was decent, but there has to be better places in Chicago to eat breakfast.

My rating is in comparison to other breakfast diners.  Food was very good and had healthy menu options.  I had the breakfast burrito with chorizo and it hit the spot.  Portion sizes were good. I came here hungry and was satisfied.  My wife had the heartland and was able to switch out some ingredients with no issue. It was like an egg white omelette with veggies.  Server was nice and friendly.  Price is reasonable.  Would come here again.

Eggs, bacon, potatoes. Excellent. Eggs, sausage (5 links!), potatoes. Excellent. Clara's Con Salsa was good but it could've  been better with heated corn tortillas. These tasted like they were put on the skillet straight from the package. Our waitress, Raquel, was fabulous as busy as they were.

This place was recommended by our hotel concierge. I don't eat eggs so I liked that they had a bigger pancake menu, compared to other places. It is a diner, I'm assuming it's family run. Only because our servers father and sister were there as well. My mother loved her breakfast it was an big easy egg skillet. I got the English walnut pancake. Both were really good. They had a pitcher of water at the table. Our meal with coffees and a side order of sausage came it to $29.

Good choice of breakfast but the place was bit dated and in need of an upgrade. We also waited for more than 20mims for a table ! Eggs Benedict was great when it arrived. Not many options of juice - only orange or grapefruit juice on the menu .

I checked in and checked right out before ordering food.  The preset cups and forks on the table were dirty.  Our waiter was apologetic and brought out clean water cups and utensils.  However, when our hot chocolate came out, it had old food stuck on the spoon.  At that point, we were done.  I would advise you to check your dishes if you decide to eat here.

A great restaurant that has a wait... Which is a good thing amongst all the places to eat in Chicago. They have a very efficient staff that are all very friendly. The food was delicious and they served portions big enough to make any hungry big man full and happy!!

This place was amaaaazinng, and within walking distance to our hotel. It's more of a traditional breakfast and a bit pricey but it's also right off the Mag Mile so what do you expect? Good food at a decent price considering. Would definitely recommend to future travelers.

We went here for a weekend brunch and wish we hadn't. The cutlery was not clean, glasses were dirty too. Food was really sub-par and the stools we sat on the bar were so wobbly. There are lot of good brunch places in the neighborhood. I wouldn't recommend anyone to go here.

West Egg Cafe I would describe as a breakfast diner. Maybe a step up from an IHOP or Denny's but this is debatable. Anyways, came by early Sunday morning to grab breakfast. Ran into some of the crew from Emirates team and Oracle team that happen to be having breakfast there before heading out on the lake for America's Cup. That was pretty cool to see. For food, I did their breakfast burrito with chorizo. The green chilies inside were a nice touch to make it seem somewhat unique. Not your typical breakfast burrito as it is doused with red sauce/salsa, sour cream and cheese on top so that you basically have at it with a knife and fork. Overall, pretty tasty and also served with a small side of fruit and homestyle potatoes which were well seasoned.    Service is minimal. They leave a pitcher of water for you at the table so you can refill your water. If you get coffee too, they'll leave the pitcher of coffee at your table to refill as you please. Once you're done, they drop off the check and you walk over to the cashier to pay your bill on your way out. The waiters/waitresses are really only there to take your order and bring out your food.  No gimmicks here, just a standard breakfast cafe with a good amount of selection of items for breakfast. Food wasn't horrible by any means but in terms of similar pricing/value I would probably hit Yolk over West Egg next time I'm not feeling like making my own breakfast. 'Til next time, cheers!

Unimpressed. Like most breakfast diners, you can probably make the food served here at home for a fraction of the price. But unlike its competitors (think Yolk, Wildberry), West Egg Cafe lacked a certain refinement that made you Want to spend money on simple breakfast food instead of going to the store and cooking in. Unimpressive breakfast for 2 + coffee + tip: $32. A little steep for 7:30am. I got the Michelangelo. Sounds like a work of art. Far from. It looked like a pizza. and tasted like a cheap breakfast pizza, without carbs. When I say pizza, I mean pizza: stale pepperoni, italian sausage, olives, peppers, crap cheese. The tomato sauce tasted straight out of a can - and not those fancy gourmet ones.  Meh - sure it filled me up, but will I go back anytime soon? Likely not.

Great spot for breakfast or lunch - we popped in during a visit to Chicago and were quite pleased with everything we tried. Scrambled eggs, sausages, basic breakfast staples were all delicious....chicken sandwich was solid and the big salad with chicken and avocado was a huge portion and super tasty. Quick service and reasonable prices. Very busy and there was a wait on a Saturday around 10am but we thought the servers and host moved things along efficiently. Would def go back.

I've always enjoyed this place. Nothing incredibly original on the menu but it's all good and the service is fast. Bonus: I love having my own carafe of coffee at my table because, let's fave ot, the worst thing at breakfast is having to wait for more coffee.

First words out of the waiter's mouth, "What's up?"  Then he forgot to ask what if I would like coffee. He came back, without the pot, and said, "Coffee?" No offer of anything else, what would I like to drink, just one word/question..."coffee?" After reading the menu I settled on steak and eggs. The portion of hash brown potatoes was minuscule, the steak, while tasty was paper thin, and eggs...well they're eggs.  Other than the rudeness and the dirty place settings (see attached picture) this place is two stars!  My check by the way...a whopping $18.00. Little high in my opinion!

I never get tired of eating at this establishment. They are always friendly, courteous, fast, and the food is always appetizing. Today was definitely no different. Albuquerque turkey Benedict is a favorite and today's veggie Benedict was awesome. Great job again. Always clean and even the restrooms are extremely well taken care of. If you come downtown this is the place for breakfast any day of the week.
I had a great breakfast here! The service was super speedy, the pancakes were great, and the restaurant was nice and clean! The veggie Benedict was an awesome take on the classic.

Our receptionist recommended them just a few steps away from the hotel. We were looking for a restaurant nearby offering a traditional, quick breakfast. And West Egg Café gave us that. We walked right past the entrance on E. Ontario. It's easy to miss. There's a glass door between Chipotle and Timothy O'Toole's Pub. The hallway will take you to the restaurant, or you can go through the main entrance around the corner on N. Fairbanks. The restaurant was very busy, but we were seated immediately. Our server was nice. I'm so glad he suggested one pancake instead of a full order (3) because they're so large. One was enough for me. We were both surprised at how fast the food came out, no more than 5 minutes after we placed the order! AND, it was all correct. Our eggs were scrambled hard just like we asked. Serving sizes were good too. We never felt rushed, but I get the feeling they don't want you to linger too long after finishing because they have so many other waiting customers. There were a few tables for seating outside on E. Ontario. The bill is paid at the counter, not at the table.  I would recommend them if you're looking for a good breakfast, nothing fancy - they do the basics well.

Excellent fast service. Friendly staff. Very clean. I like that they put a whole pot of coffee on your table. I had an order of rye toast and bacon and it was served with scallions and tomatoes...perfect. My husband had the Bacado omelette with bacon, Monterey Jack, avocado and homemade salsa. Very good. I would definitely come back.
Is place is very good. Lots of food, quick service, nice atmosphere, and they have coffee and water pitchers at the table. They win.

Nice bright breakfast and lunch family no-wait restaurant a few short blocks east of Michigan Avenue. With huge windows that open onto the Fairbanks sidewalk there is always a robust people watching entertainment advantage to eating here.

Found this place near the hotel I was staying. It's a simple looking diner with an extensive menu. Service was super friendly and helpful with questions. The veggie omelet I ordered was good, but lacked some kick. Plan to go back and try something different off the menu.

Went there for a business breakfast. Fast, friendly service for people on the go. We both enjoyed our meals. I had the Magmile Mushroom and liked it very much. A mushroom and cheese mini-casserole, eggs, potatoes and an English muffin. Filling but I didn't feel stuffed afterward. Would definitely return and recommend.
Amazing!!! Best pancakes so far and lovely staff!!!  Good price for central area and can have kids portions made too with no fuss!! Coffee kept coming!!

I had the Turkey eggs Benedict and loved it. Casual spot but a very good breakfast spot. We were seated and fed quickly , even in a busy Mother's Day Sunday.  Vice nice staff gave us good recommendations and made us feel welcome.
Great food at reasonable prices. Place was packed and service was still excellent! Had the steak and eggs. Standard diner steak but good. Will come back

I came here twice while I was visiting Chicago because it was close to where I was staying and the food was great! I got the same thing each time, but really enjoyed it and would come back again. Good healthy options without breaking the bank.
Blueberry cashew pancakes are awesome and I've never seen them anywhere else!!! I give them the edge over yolk. :-)

This is a diner. The breakfast is good. The servers are nice. The place isn't brand new but it's clean. You might have to wait 10-15 minutes, nothing crazy. If you're looking for a fancy brunch with something new and creative, this isn't it. It isn't going to change the way you think about breakfast and it's not going to make it into your list of adventures I had this weekend. This is a diner. They do their breakfast very well but it's a breakfast menu you've seen before. The price point is fair. There are a lot of tables and it's lively but not too loud. I did appreciate the coffee they had while we waited and it isn't a problem to wait inside because they have s side hallway. This is good if the weather isn't cooperating because yolk has limited indoor space and people often have to wait outdoors
Good price, fast service and good portions. They give you your own water pitcher and coffee carafe. Perfect breakfast spot!

The menu and decor are imaginative fun and cheerful. I LOVE their menus because they have Humpty Dumpy egg animated  cartoons. We ordered the Chorizo and eggs omelet, and traditional plain pancakes. I was not crazy about their pancakes, but the omelette was to die for. It came with tortillas, salsa, and a side of potatoes and sour Creme.  The best part was the cappuccino! I love the Creamy top. It was thick and just the way I like it. Actually I've been to Kanela, Waffkes Cafe, Grand Lux Cafe, Pinstripes, Doll Up, and this is far the BEsT cappuccino I've had.  We sat at the bar and Nancy was waiting on us. She is very sweet and attentive. We ordered and had our cappuccinos brought out to perfection right away and our food followed accordingly. We have been here before and it's always a popular location because its always crowded and the traffic waved come and go, which says much about this place. Nancy was telling us that the owners are originally from Dominican Republic in South Latin America. So the plates and ideas are from their roots. They've been here for at least 30years and its thriving as  my own eyes witnesses. All the staff move around pretty fast and I love the energy that they carry through the restaurant.  Also the names on the menu are pretty funny and catchy. As you receive the bill, you have to go to the counter and pay there, which I wish they would just take the payment as normal restaurants do, but the food sure makes it worth your while.  You can also choose from different souvenirs for all ages. They have baby onesies and T-shirts, hats etc. We will be back. So far the best breakfast spot in Streeterville.

"Meh" sums the experience up pretty well.  I had plans to meet three friends for breakfast at 10:30. The earliest friend arrived about five minutes early and was seated right away. Another friend and I got there at 10:32. We were looking at the menus while waiting for the fourth friend to arrive when the server came to take our order at 10:37. We said we were going to wait until our fourth member arrived to order (she had just walked through the door) when the server rudely interrupted to say "In case you weren't aware, we have quite a large wait and it would be appreciated if you hurried up" before walking away. The rest of the meal was rushed. Checks were dropped off super early in the meal and we were asked several times if we had finished yet so plates could be cleared. Food was adequate -- nothing special. It was edible and coffee was continuously refilled so I gave two stars.  I used to be a server so I'm well aware that the faster you flip a table, the faster you make a tip. But taking seven minutes to peruse a menu and relax is normal, and there was no reason for our server to be as hostile and impatient as he was.
Stopped for lunch.  Was looking forward to rotisserie chicken but the flavor was flat...it's not brined enough.  Decent food, decent service, just didn't meet my expectations of flavor.

We were excited to try West Egg during our weekend stay in Chicago. We love finding good breakfast spots when we travel...however, I don't think this was one of them. We thought we we found a good hole-in-the-wall diner offering an unique experience, but you can find better food and much better service at IHOP. The entire staff was in a very "get you in and get you out" mode (mid-morning on a Monday?). Our server did not even greet us, she just asked "can I get your drinks" and when she returned with the drinks, she just asked "are you ready to order?".  The food was really bland and boring, despite sounding really great on the menu. To make matters worse, the coffee was terrible. Up until this point, I had experienced excellent coffee during our stay, but the coffee at West Egg was old and had a terrible after-taste. The awful service really made the whole experience not as enjoyable as we anticipated.

*first review* My friends and I were desperately searching for a brunch place with a wait time of less than 40 minutes (this was during the St. Patrick's Day Parade). After walking to three different restaurants, we finally found West Egg Cafe on Yelp. It was pretty packed, but the wait was only 20 minutes so we thought we'd give it a try. I ordered Prince Jon's Fruity Toast and it was so delicious! The raisin bread French toast comes with strawberries and bananas, and a side of strawberry puree. If you have a sweet tooth like me, this is definitely something you need to try. My boyfriend ordered Alecia's Chocolate Chip Pancakes and devoured it. Our waiter was great, too. Overall, excellent food and excellent service.

Solid place to go to to help combat the throes of hungoverness that you are in.  Your typical diner fare.  Coffee is adequate, service is fast.  Even though it is in a non descript location, I was surprised to see the throngs of people waiting to get seated.  Definitely not a destination worthy stop but in a pinch, it does the trick.
There poor boy sandwich was amazing. Service was great. Busy but worth the wait. Waffles light serving size generious.

Had the skillet. ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT!!!! Ended up going back a second day for the same thing. I got a bacon, potato, mushroom, and onion skillet with a scrambled egg. Doesn't need a lot. I was full yesterday until almost dinner time. We are this around 11:30ish. Very excited and will come again next year when we are back for the volleyball tournament. Cost was pretty decent. Portions size was great.

This place was great!  At first,  we weren't sure we would be able to eat there,  as we had our double stroller with us and the only entrance had steps.  However,  the staff bent over backwards to help us and our children get in a different way.  The service was fantastic and the food was delicious (we were there for breakfast).

Overall I wasn't impressed. My perception is that it would be a cute breakfast place but it is a diner. It has the feel and sound of a Waffle House.  I got the chocolate chip pancakes and they were mediocre. My husband got a frittata with potatoes and the frittata was alright--not outstanding--but the potatoes were just salty and lacking in true flavor. If you're looking for a quick place to get food, or if you're looking for hangover food, this place could be okay. However, compared to the many other fantastic restaurants Chicago has to offer, this one falls far short.
Came to West Egg for the first time. I was skeptical about the place at first but food wasn't bad. Ordered a veggie skillet with eggs sunny side up.  Service wasn't bad.
Delicious hash and eggs. Ok pancakes. Great to find a diner in the the city near our hotel

Egggcelent!! Super hardy and delicious. Best of all, all the people who work there are super friendly and accommodating. We wanted substitutions done to our food and they were completely fine with that and didn't charge us more. It was great.

Come here for super quick service, especially during lunch hours(on weekdays). The grilled chicken sandwich with bacon and avocado is THE BEST and comes with tasty hashbrowns. This contributed greatly to the 4th star. The roasted chicken option is a good deal as well, although it won't be the best you've ever had. The breakfast items are pretty standard taste-wise(is that a word?), and the pancakes are huge. Definitely will visit over and over again, especially when starving.

If you haven't tried West Egg Cafe you are definitely missing out! The food is great. They have SO many choices! Every time I come here I try something different and they never fail to satisfy me. The kitchen manager Victor is always very nice to us. My favorite breakfast cafe

We went on a Tuesday morning in February and it was not crowded. We were seated immediately, and it felt like our food arrived almost instantly after we ordered. The Bleu Bayou scramble was excellent, and my daughters enjoyed their strawberry waffles. I imagine this place gets really crowded on summer weekends. Friendly service, casual vibe. A great weekday breakfast experience.

Tried another brunch place but wouldn't deal with the 2 hour wait.  I found this little gem instead.   Great service.  A pitcher of water waiting for you at the table.  Very little wait time despite the big crowd.   I had the Haileys English Walnut pancakes..amazing.   They brought over warmed honey and some blueberries for a topping. Two pancakes was sufficient.   I also tried the Feta Frittata which is very good.   I was impressed with the healthy breakfast options.  I can't wait to visit again.
I've been coming here since I was a kid and love it. It's worth the wait for sure. Food is simple, plenty of choices and big portions!

We had a wonderful experience here. We were looking for an alternative to crappy overpriced hotel buffet. Two giant breakfasts for $20 an awesome waiter and a cute little place a short walk from the magnificent mile.

I like this spot because it's casual and reminds me a bit of back home in KY. It's not country or anything - it's just simple in decor and good food. A bit more spacious than many breakfast options. Good location with being near Mag mile but towards the lake where it's a tad quieter. It was a perfect spot to eat during my stay at the Double Tree hotel right next door. Really appreciate the whole wheat walnut pancake with sugar free syrup and the healthy broccoli spinach omelet options. The coffee was delicious. I ate a whole pot by myself! Also loved how the water picture with lemon in it sat on the table upon being seated! Only reason they don't get five stars is because the food wasn't hot which was a disappointment for how much I was looking forward to splurging on a pancake!

If you're looking for an average, inexpensive bfast joint, this is your place. Food was nothing above average. My girl got an egg blt and she wouldn't finish it. Bread wasn't toasted. Who in the world doesn't toast their bread on a BLT?! Coffee was $3/person, which is a little cray.
Had breakfast here before Bears /Lions game. Food not great, potatoes dry, omelet had green peppers that were not fully cooked. Would not recommend, rather walk a few blocks down and go to Yolk.
Great breakfast with good portions! Very accommodating to younger children. Reasonably priced. Own downfall is they don't sell any alcoholic beverages for brunch!

My husband and I decided to go here for breakfast because it was close to our hotel. It was pretty busy, the wait for a table was a bit confusing though (people forming random lines). We were escorted to a back room after walking through a hall way- looked like they are expanding! We ordered the Fetta Frittata and fresh orange juice. It was good but nothing special. They need to replace their plates/utensils.

Came here with my mom when we were staying in downtown Chicago. Pretty standard breakfast. Quick service. We were seated right away, our food came out relatively fast. Staff wasn't too interested in providing detailed answers to our questions but that's okay. I thought my breakfast was standard but totally adequate. My mom had something off the "Healthy" menu. The bran muffin was awesome but I doubt it was actually healthy. Tasted too sweet and amazing to be low sugar or anything like that. I mean, I'm sure there was some bran in it, but it tasted like something off the "beware" list on a dieting magazine for things that seem healthy but actually are not.  I had an egg white omelette and ate the whole thing. It was good. Potatoes were nothing to write home about but again totally fine. Coffee was also fine and I liked that they serve it with the pot because my version of a cup of coffee is actually a pot of coffee. I'll come back if I'm in the area but wouldn't go out of my way....probably more interesting places to eat in the city.

The West Egg is a great diner! It is a place my dad and I love to go every time I'm in town to visit them in Chicago. Our favorite thing is to grab a seat at the "bar" which really makes you feel like you're at an old school diner. The breakfast is just so good. My dad always gets the blueberry pancakes which is a triple stack of yumminess and I get the eggs benedict, my favorite. Coffee isn't the best but hey, it's a diner and they have good juice. This place fills up really fast but the wait is never too long.

Decided to head out in the elements for some breakfast. We asked around and the West egg was recommended. Short walk from the hotel and we arrived . The place was packed but we got a seat at the bar in no time . I had the steak and eggs, deliciousness!!!! The service was amazing, our servers name was Annie and she was awesome ... we are only staying a few days in Chicago,but I know where breakfast is tomorrow. . And Annie, I got your coffee...

By far one of the best places to get a quick bite to eat that is just off of the mile. The entrance is marked by a small door and a big sign, but as soon as you walk in, it opens to a rather large, bustling facility. What makes this place great is that the waiters/waitresses are speedy all in the right ways . My party and I came in, and were immediately given a pitcher of water and coffee. Within 25 minutes our food was ready, and was DELICIOUS. There really isn't anything bad about this place, I will definitely come back here. Prices were about on the high side of average for breakfast, but trust me, West Egg is almost certainly worth it.
Quick service.  Great staff.  Good variety.  Had the basic western omelet which came with potatos and English muffin.  Loved this place and convenient to the courtyard Marriott!!

We are from out of town, and the hotel concierge sent us to West Egg for breakfast! What a great place! Not only was breakfast delicious, but out server Annie was amazing! She was friendly, prompt, and made sure we had exactly what we needed.  If you are looking for a great home away from home breakfast spot this is it!

In search of a late breakfast that would see us through a plane ride home without paying airport food prices, we found West Egg, and West Egg delivered. The tiny storefront is deceiving; the main dining area goes way back from the street. It was pretty full when we arrived, but a host led us through a side door, through a hallway under construction, and into an even larger space. In contrast to the warm wood of the main dining room, this one is all white, as if it's complete enough to use, but they haven't had time to decorate. They certainly needed the extra space on this morning. I can't think of very many things that'll stick to your ribs more than corned beef hash. West Egg sent out a generous portion, simple but very good, rich but not greasy. It came with some fluffy scrambled eggs and an English muffin, which I could only eat about half of, and a small cup of fruit that was riper and tastier than usual. Our food came out quickly for as busy as they were, and our server was nice. They leave a pitcher of ice water and coffee on your table, which is convenient although it made our table a little crowded. Prices make for an affordable big meal downtown.

Great find . Walking I found this gem and was able to get in about 9am. After I left, there was a 1-1/2 hr wait. The menu us a wide range ( for folks like me that don't eat bacon, eggs, biscuits, Gravy etc. , but it also looked great. Service was awesome.  I will be back many times.  Could use more non pork meat items.

The food itself was mediocre. There was quite a crowd when we got in. The server was quite friendly. I got the steak and eggs. I didn't hate it, but I also didn't like it. My friend got the Michalangelo on recommendation and she just didn't like it. We probably won't go back there if we come to Chicago, nor would we recommend it
Fast, friendly, and always in/out. I love the Denver scramble, biscuits and gravy, and must try the chicken fried steak. Yum
Loved this place. Was in town for a week. Went every day. Service a little laid back but it's morning - who has time to rush?

A bright little breakfast place in downtown . It's a fun place to eat and people watch .  The only downside when we went was the service was a little slow .  The food was great !!!  The special skillet is :  Potatoes , cheese , green chiles , guacamole and eggs , a great combination !  the green chiles weren't spicy but still good .

Came on Saturday, food wasn't bad, we had the turkey eggs benedict. But the line was ridiculous! If I lived in Chicago I would eat breakfast at home. These lines aren't worth it. Seated at the counter in a spot were the Fair banks entrance door was constantly being opened and the cold and wind blew all over us. The service was spotty with condiments missing and having to reach for stuff over other diners. Not worth it! Lock the door and make every body enter in one spot to prevent the draft. Restrooms at the end of a weird under construction/industrial stairwell. Has to be better places.
Wonderful breakfast! Breakfast burrito with chicken was huge and serviced with potatoes and fruit. My husband had the country fried steak. Hands down the best country fried steak ever! Great service
The best corned beef hash I have had in Chicago. Perfectly cooked eggs, pleasant wait person, clean, fast service and good coffee; my new go to place for breakfast.
Great food. I had the club sandwich and it was outstanding. Frenchtoast ok but not fabulous. Staff very atentive.

Came here for lunch because it was close to church. Food was just okay. Standard breakfast fare. We all got omelettes. If you're in a bind, it's not the worst you could do, but there are definitely better lunch venues in downtown Chicago.

Props for doing the poached egg right!. Wanted to try grits for my first time here too, though was told it's a bit soupy. Great casual breakfast spot-- would travel out of my way for their poached eggs!
Really enjoyed our breakfast. The place was very busy on the weekend, but they got us in quickly and the food was out fast. Our server Jonathan was very attentive. Great food. Great service.

Absolutely love coming to the West egg Café. every time we visit the city this is a must stop for breakfast. Had the eggs Benedict...it's a good classic breakfast to have... Ham was a little on the tough side, which is the only reason that this review is getting four stars instead of five. it's not that it didn't taste good that it was tough to cut through and really hard enjoy the eggs Benedict (didn't finish it) when the ham isn't tender. However all great things to say from the coffee... Which I happen to be very picky about... To a new favorite of ours, the Bacado Omlette!!! If you love avocados and bacon... This is for you! Eggs were delicious and fluffy in the omelette, and we loved loved the potatoes. I ordered a side of salsa which was really great for dipping the potatoes...looked tomatoe-y but had nice flavor. We would be remiss if we didn't tell you that our server and he was delightful. We love that even though it was a busy Saturday morning she took the time to chat with my daughter and I just briefly... And even shared a little life-advice which made it seem like we were visiting an old friend.

Other than my scrambled egg coming to the table like a fried egg, everything was well. The blueberry pancakes were large and tasty, definitely a "shareable" portion. The bacon was tasty and crispy and not soggy-the eat bacon should be :-) The server was very friendly, I was seated promptly.

So my server was awesome bald dude with a leg tattoo. I forgot to get his name however he was absolutely great and in no way did his services reflect my review . In fact i applud you for working for people who clearly don't give a damn. My fiance and I ordered the turkey eggs bendidict  and  the corned beef and hash. The eggs benedict looked and tasted amazing Hands down the best part of our experience In Your Establishment a unique taste for sure. If I ever come back I know what I would get. It's never a good sign when someone needs to start a new paragraph to talk about the negatives. Here is how it all went south. It took literally 5 min to get our food after we ordered. We were freaked out how fast it came out  obviously did not cook it fresh with time and care.  The corned beef and hash had clearly come from a can. It was an embarrassment to even have been served that slop in your establishment. All the pictures on yelp in no way resembled the cat food I was served today.  It was runnny (not the eggs)and there weren't no actual pieces of corned beef in my C.B.H . Why even have it on the menu if you know it's awful.
Great brunch spot! Loved the Best Western Omelette.

Quick turnover of tables. Went 9 am day before the marathon. Lots of people, but short wait. Very professional. Tables set before you sit down. Had the California omelet topped with alfalfa sprouts. Fresh broccoli, mushrooms and avocado.  Side cup of a celery seed sweet vinaigrette. Side of fruit or potatoes. Delicious!

We were craving a breakfast and couldn't get up at the usual time for breakfast with time zone change. This place is local, open until 3 and was AWESOME. The menu was really great with everything you could ask for and more and the staff was friendly. We got our own coffee pot and water jug and they checked on us regularly.  Would recommend if your in Chicago. Must try!
Great restaurant! Reasonable prices, great service with attentive waitstaff, healthy options available...
Grab a cup of that diner coffee and get a skillet - top it off with bacon, andouille sausage, chorizo and mushrooms - and you won't regret it! I call it the "Meat Your Maker" skillet.
Food was good (Omelette and breakfast burrito). Service was good. Right across the street from our hotel. Done.

ICame here just because it was close to hotel. What a treat. Clean, friendly, great coffee and an excellent breakfast, I had the blue bayou and it came with potatoes and an English muffin. Nice introduction to Chicago

I had an AWESOME breakfast at the bar one sunny Saturday morning. I had the avocado/huevos rancheros meal which was delightful. Food is definitely a 5. The speed and approach to the service was a strong 4. So, somewhere between a 4-5 lies this place.

Came here on a rainy Saturday for brunch. The wait is pretty good for brunch in Streeterville. Got a table for three in 20 minutes. The menu is typical of a brunch place - omelettes, skillets, pancakes. Didn't see anything on the menu that really stood out to me. I got a ham and mushroom skillet, which was good. It came with a small cup of fruit and an english muffin.   Ambience is a small diner feel. Unpretentious though a little loud. The staff is friendly. I thought the food was a bit generic, but it's a great place for a casual brunch with plenty of choices.

I was in town this past weekend and on my last morning in Chicago, decided to have breakfast at West Egg Cafe which was just down the street from my hotel where I was staying. Pretty basic looking cafe but it was clean and there were lots of people there enjoying their meals. I had the Denver scramble which was quite delicious. Nothing too heavy or nor was the proportions huge which was something I wasn't looking for in a breakfast. If you are looking for a place that serves hashbrowns this isn't it. I didn't mind though, I wasn't looking to be in a food coma. Coffee was good too. I could have lived without the crack from the server when I tried to pour the water and some of it ended up on the table and lap. Otherwise it was a nice quick breakfast to get me on my way of some more sight seeing in the city.

Since I've been coming here for at least 5 years I thought that I already had given this gem a review already.  This is a strong 4. Some days and visits it's a 5.  Splendid location and great staff.  Could be a little crowded if you're late.  The food is always a 5. My recommendations: Albuquerque Turkey Benedict Bandito Omelette  The Grabowski, with smoked polish sausage.

The food was great! I recommend the turkey Benedict, there was hardly any wait on a Saturday morning so that is really nice. Our waitress was very attentive, and I love the self serve coffee and water right on the table. Only bad thing. It was a little loud because we sat too close to the dish station. Other than that it was a great breakfast

The West Egg Cafe is an okay place to get breakfast, but it isn't going to be an outstanding experience and the food won't blow you away. If you're looking for some basic pancakes, eggs, breakfast potatoes at a sub-$10 cost, it works well. The service here was lacking. It took 10 minutes for someone to come by to take our order. When we wanted the check, it was 15 minutes of waiting for our waiter to come by.
Rainy Chicago morning. But West Egg warm and ready for Saturday morning!  Great food and lovely servers. Eggs, steak, and bacon, of course!

The price was adequate for what we got, which was pleasantly surprising. We got straight in for brunch on a Friday morning, no wait. Really liked the breakfast potatoes, but nothing was really anything to write home about.

Finally found a good breakfast/brunch place near Streeterville, that won't break the budget. West Egg feels like a small-town diner, imported into a big-city location. And when it's early in the morning, that's just what the doctor ordered. When you enter the building, you might be a little concerned depending on what door you walk through. They're going through construction right now so one of the entrances seems like it's a for-sale property, still undergoing renovations(much like the rest of Chicago). Once you make it inside though you'll be pleasantly surprised to see quaint tables, friendly waitresses, and an unmistakable smell of eggs, pancakes and everything else breakfast. The menu is fairly normal size for a diner, featuring a wide variety of different pancakes, waffles, omelets, and other breakfast specials(many with, but also many without, egg). I got the Biscuits and Sausage Gravy, which came with home-fried potatoes, a sausage link, and two eggs cooked to my specifications. My friends got two omelets, and a California crepe(sort of like a very thin rolled omelet, but filled with avocado and other vegetables and topped with alfalfa sprouts). The food itself was all good, though the omelets seemed a little more dense and less fluffy than I usually prefer. The biscuits were flavorful, though they could have been fluffier. Quite enjoyed the sausage gravy, wish they could have spooned a little more of it on. Eggs were cooked perfectly and the homefries were crispy as well.  Granted, I was not wowed by West Egg, but I would come back here again. Solid food, Solid portions, Solid price; Especially in the streeterville area it's good to see a local breakfast spot that I'd be proud to be a regular at.
Delicious breakfast  and great service too.  Hearty  portions and they give you your own coffee carafe.  It's only a short walk from magnificent mile hotels.   100 times better than hotel breakfast
Fast, Friendly, personal service! Great staff. Loved the breakfast. Pancakes are wonderful! Prices are reasonable. Would definitely recommend to my friends!

Food is delicious. I had the spinach and mushroom crepe and yogurt with granola. The wait was not too bad - it moved fairly well. My only complaints are that their coffee - superior brand - is NOT good. I had the cappuccino and my friend had a regular coffee. Both left a lot to be desired. And the portions are huge. I felt really bad wasting half my meal, but when I order a crepe I don't expect THREE. But the food is delicious and I would definitely go back. If they change their coffee I would give them 5 stars
If you can tell food is made with love than this place is the opposite. The food isn't disgusting, but it was just bland, boring, and not fresh. The service was nice though.
Great place for breakfast in Chicago. The food is really good and the staff is very friendly. My lox scramble was very good.   This is the only place I have breakfast when in town.
Delicious, many healthy options, excellent fast service, cute atmosphere, will dine here again, even though I have a short stay in town.

This place is much better than yolk! I ordered mushroom eggcerlence! My friend ordered a bacon omelet. The egg tastes awesome and the potatoes are cooked right to how they should be! Will back again!!

It's a breakfast cafe, right? This one strikes that perfect balance between Chicago-One-Word-Trendy-Hour-Wait-Overpriced place and GreasyIsGood-ButDirty-BadCoffee-Ugly place. Bacado omelette wasn't big--sorta flat--but was tasty and generous portions for the plate. The 6-table sidewalk cafe was really pleasant, my server was kind and on point and went out her way to jump to help people with things. Remove a star because I was trying to do a working lunch, and the wifi wasn't functional. The owner apparently knew about the problem but hasn't fixed it. I connected to a nearby pub wifi instead, which probably is not a fan of West Egg customers poaching.
Great service!  Everything was good and reasonably priced.  We each had recommendations from our waiter, Rudy, and each egg dish was really good!

Two eggs scrambled with potatoes and an English muffin. My standby! I love breakfast for lunch, and this fits the bill. Tasty, ample portions, and a great value. It gets busy at times, but I've never had a wait to sit at the counter. I will go back.

Gord and I had breakfast this morning at the West Egg Cafe.   Gord ordered The Grabowski.  He said it was good and he'd get it again. I got Pork Chops and Eggs.  It was good and I'd get it again. Both were big portions!  There was a lot of food!   Jennifer was our server.  She was friendly and took good care of us. We'd go back.

Haven't been to this place for years even though I work in the neighborhood because I remember being underwhelmed during my first visit. But was pleasantly surprised when I went in for lunch recently. Service was friendly & fast, the sandwich I ordered was fresh and the portion was huge for the price. I easily got two meals out of it. It's a solid diner.
The bleu cheese omelette was my favorite but everything was delicious. Such a neat find on our vacation! It has your classic diner feeling to it

Nice little breakfast spot on the corner near Northwestern Medical Center. I had an egg dish with potatoes and english muffins.  The service was good and I loved sitting right on the corner watching all the hustle and bustle of the big city.

Damn fine diner.  Very fast and friendly service, old school "Chicago-sized" portions (read HUGE!!), good prices for what you get.  Wife had the "Spicoli" omelette, which was very good.  I ended up tempted by the "Sicilian Poor Boy", which I thought was amazing.  Both of us were more than pleased with our selections.  Great place for a quick and satisfying breakfast and/or lunch.

A diner in the middle of fancytown Chicago. This was one of the first places we went to in Streeterville and it has a pretty cool vibe. You can wait for a table or just sit up at the breakfast bar, which we did. It was busy even on Monday but we had good service.  The breakfast food was better than the lunch food for sure. I ended up getting the veggie sandwich, and it was good, but the breakfast stuff - toast, hashbrowns, etc were all much better.  This is kind of a unique gem for the area and I would recommend it if you're looking for the classic feel of a diner in the middle of Chicago. It doesn't have the pomp of other brunch places in big cities, but doesn't skimp on the food quality either.

Good breakfast and brunch spot.  Although I think Yolk does french toast and other griddle options a bit better, West Egg stands out for its great house made rotisserie chicken.   Most of the time I order it, it's tender juicy and comes with a side of good BBQ sauce.  At 9.95 for a whole chicken you can't go wrong, especially if it's really well prepared.  It should be noted you get a whole pitcher of water with lemon slices when you sit down, and a carafe of coffee if you order coffee--nice touch.  During the weekends, there's a line, but it's a bit shorter than the one at Yolk.

I came here for breakfast on a Friday morning. There was a 10 minute wait. On the tables, they have a pitcher of water, syrup, mugs, water glasses and utensils. This was an interesting way to save time for the waiters. The food here was good. It came out quickly. I ordered an omelet. It came with potatoes and an English muffin. Overall, the food and service were good and I would return for breakfast.

We are from out of town and stopped here on the fly.  My buddy and I both had the Clara's con salsa, and our ladies had egg dishes.  All of the food was awesome, even the garnish fruit cup was fresh and delicious.  Fast, friendly service.  Worth every penny.

Four stars for extremely quick food service and large portions at a cheap price. This is without a doubt a quick stop in place. I would say it is very similar in quality and offerings to IHOP, but it's conveniently located and they know how to feed people quickly! Definitely recommend for any tourists needing a change from hotel breakfast or anyone with a group of picky eaters.
Took 20 minutes to be seated, food came out very fast and was tasty.   Good diner stop-off.

I stayed at the hotel down the street and and came in for breakfast two days in a row . If you are looking for Reasonably price breakfast or lunch this  is the place. Service was unbelievably fast . The food was good and tasty. Staff is a little more interested in getting you fed and out the door. Weren't very friendly but who is at 7 o'clock in the morning.
The turkey sausage was freezer burned. Good place to have in downtown though!
Awesome breakfast!! I had the Bandito omelette and was amazing and my husband had the growkowski (something like that) and he loved it!

Ok spot for a typical breakfast. We stayed across the street at the doubletree while visiting Chicago. Read somewhat decent yelp reviews so I thought I'd give it a try. Lots of menu options with silly names for each of the dishes. Food was fine, coffee was so so. Service was ok. Was a convenient breakfast, but can't say I'd go back.
This was a great restaurant that had a very local feel. Our waiter, Michael, was personable and funny. The food was fabulous and I would strongly recommend this place to anybody.
Very unique offerings with great breakfast and lunch food.  Good location close to everything, not too out of the way.
Meh......I expected so much more.  The canned corn beef hash was a major let down.  Perhaps my hopes were too high and I'm a breakfast guy but yikes, it's just not that good.
Great diner. Good service. You'll enjoy your meal. If you come on a weekend you will have to wait. Coffee and water are on your table.

Under construction and getting to our table was a maze but worth it! The menu has so many different unique items. All of my friends ordered different things so we could try everything! Chicken and eggs totally go together!

The menu was extensive. It was really difficult to choose what to order. We started w/the cheese stuffed mushroom app. Delish. I ordered the Sicilian po boy. It came w/a side of potatoes that were excellent. The sandwich was just ok. The staff was very attentive and accommodating.
I ate breakfast at the bar on a busy Saturday morning.  My veggie omelette was delicious, and the service was relaxed and gracious.  I'd definitely recommend West Egg for breakfast or brunch.

Exactly what I expected and was looking for: a unique breakfast spot near, but not too close, to my hotel. Menu was varied and fun. Decor was a step up from a typical diner and very welcoming. Service staff was very good and fast. The Bandito omlette was good but not great.
Very good for breakfast all day.  Upscale Greek oriented menu of creative breakfast options.  Mobbed on weekends, so go early.  Always fast, pleasant service.
My friends and I got breakfast here before seeing a movie at Navy Pier. The food was good, and the service was quick and friendly.

Service was great- food was only OK. They were efficient and nice, the place is clean and prompt... But the food, literally, was only "ok". We had Eggs Benedict and Raisin French toast. I've had worse, I've had better. I wouldn't suggest you go out of your way for this place- but if you're hungry and happen upon it, I wouldn't run away.

Very solid cafe. Reasonable prices for reasonably good food. The Big Easy Skillet was good, a pretty typical skillet of scrambled eggs and cheese with some mild Cajun seasoning. The French Toast was also good. Not the best ever, but very satisfying for a casual breakfast and I enjoyed West Egg's twist of using cinnamon raisin bread. Really, a great idea! The service was good; we were seated right away on a Sunday when many other places still had a line out the door for brunch. They also got us water and coffee pretty much as soon as we were seated, which I greatly appreciated! Also, I didn't try it, but a friend tried their fresh-pressed apple cider and said it was excellent. Oh, by the way, the menu was HUGE! Lots of choices. Overall, nice little cafe.
Great omelette...plenty of ham, cheese and mushrooms. Good service and quick too. I dont think you can go wrong with anything on the menu.

We demolished everything on our plate! The food was deeelish! Everyone was friendly and we were seated within 10 minutes. The prices were good too. Strongly recommend this spot if you're looking for a great breakfast! What we had: -Albuquerque Turkey Benedict -Special chorizo Skillet  -Crunchberry pancake
